result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael N. MALCHEK was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with the sentences imposed in 14 CF 97 and 14 CF 156 and with the sentence presenty being served in Kewaunee County.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum and Order to Sheriff to transport defendant for Preliminary Hearing on 05-30-14 at 3:45 p.m.  
Copy filed.
Jewel Scharenbroch, Public Defender.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.  Preliminary hearing is set for 05-30-14 at 3:45 p.m.   Bail is set at $5,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that defendant must report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 24 hours and defendant is to have no contact with James Rahmlow or his residence.   Bail furnished.
